last_post.content:
This is fascinating! The Braille Institute has developed a font - free to download - that's designed to be clearer for readers with lower vision.

An example of one of the aspects of low legibility that they tackled attached.

It's named Atkinson Hyperlegible. Atkinson was the Institute's founder - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._Robert_Atkinson

Here's where you can read about the font and download it: https://brailleinstitute.org/freefont

#Accessibility

title: Brave Adds Support for Bridges in Private Windows with Tor | Brave Browser

last_post.content: Plus, you can now easily run a @torproject Snowflake inside of your @brave client, which allows you to be a proxy for the Tor network! Snowflake proxies are intended to be ephemeral so they are hard for censors to find but easy for Tor to deliver to people who need a way round censorship. Snowflake bridges have seen massive use in Iran over the last couple of months as the government increasingly restricts internet freedom. https://brave.com/tor-bridges/
Ahhh! There are so many good writing / researching tips here in this collection of posts by @clive https://clivethompson.medium.com/list/writing-hacks-614c44bed913

Very excited to announce that the 3rd annual Data Mishaps Night will be happening on Thurs, Feb 23rd! 🍌

DaMN is a free virtual event featuring a lineup of speakers sharing the lessons they learned the hard way and the data mistakes that built them.

We’re also opening a call for speakers! If you have a story about that time you accidentally took down prod, released a model that flopped, or had nulls screw up your calculations, we want to hear about it!

Apply to speak: https://datamishapsnight.typeform.com/registration
Dates for cohort 3 of Building a Zettelkasten for Writers is now up. Registration will go live early next week. https://bobdoto.computer/zettelkasten-class

title: The National Academies Press | Illustrating the Impact of the  Mathematical Sciences

last_post.content: Over the last few years, I have served on a committee of the National Academy of Sciences #NAS to produce some posters and other related media to showcase twenty-first century #mathematics and its applications in the real world, suitable for display in classrooms or math departments. Our posters (together with some associated commentary, webinars on related topics, and even a whimsical "comic") are now available for download at https://nap.nationalacademies.org/resource/other/deps/illustrating-math/interactive/ .

The NEH Office of Digital Humanities newsletter is sent 2-4 times each year with news about awards, events, dh research, and upcoming deadlines.

I’m not primarily on mastodon for work, but did want to share today’s newsletter with you all and encourage you to sign up and share widely.

https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/USNEH/bulletins/341c97b

#DigitalHumanities @dh #histodons

title: Germany, EU remain heavily dependent on imported fossil fuels

last_post.content:
1.5 years ago Germany imported more than 60% of the gas it consumed from Russia.

Since late August 2022 it is 0%.

The scale of this change is incredible and would have been thought of as impossible in the past.

https://www.cleanenergywire.org/factsheets/germanys-dependence-imported-fossil-fuels

I wrote up how to use entity rules to override a textcat model in spaCy, which I covered quickly in my normconf talk: https://medium.com/@lynn-72328/using-rules-with-a-spacy-textcat-classifier-for-nsfw-content-26ca417611a #spacy #nlp #nlproc

Let's just step back and take stock of how phenomenal it is that @medium has created the me.dm instance, for their users on Mastodon (https://blog.medium.com/medium-embraces-mastodon-19dcb873eb11).

Medium is a commercial online publishing platform. Rather than see Mastodon as competition, Medium is offering their users me.dm, a Mastodon instance, as a benefit. Something which will make Medium more attractive.

Mastodon is a now a Medium feature.

This is new and revolutionary.

Our Annual Review piece "Replicability, Robustness, and Reproducibility in Psychological Science" was the 4th most downloaded article across Annual Review journals in 2022 (https://www.annualreviews.org/page/top-2022).

Because of that, they have made the formatted version openly accessible for a limited time (https://www.annualreviews.org/doi/10.1146/annurev-psych-020821-114157).

And, the Green OA version is always open: https://psyarxiv.com/ksfvq/

#Kommunikation mit versch. Zielgruppen ist ein wesentlicher Teil bei der Arbeit mit #OpenAccess. Darüber sprechen wir in der Fokusgruppe "Open Access Kommunikation" des @openaccessnetwork.

Auch das Setting an der eigenen Institution bestimmt das Vorgehen wesentlich mit. Darüber spricht am 19.1. unser Gast @benkaden von @openaccessbrandenburg. Wir freuen uns sehr auf seine Erfahrungen!

Wer sich der #Fokusgruppe anschließen möchte, kann sich gerne melden!

Weitere Infos: https://open-access.network/vernetzen/digitale-fokusgruppen/fokusgruppe-kommunikation

Assessing ExxonMobil’s global warming projections https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.abk0063

For decades, some members of the fossil fuel industry tried to convince the public that a causative link between fossil fuel use and climate warming could not be made because the models used to project warming were too uncertain. Supran et al. show that one of those fossil fuel companies, ExxonMobil, had their own internal models that projected warming trajectories consistent with those forecast by the independent models

title: Robert Tinney's Visions Of The Future - Doc Pop's Blog

last_post.content:
Robert Tinney was the cover artist for Byte magazine from 1975-1986, where he cranked out these fantastic paintings that captured the spirit of tech from that time. Here is one of my favorites (from 1981). #RetroComputing #Byte

I've shared more of Robert's retro-futuristic paintings on my blog https://docpop.org/2020/11/robert-tinneys-visions-of-the-future/

Robert is also selling prints via his site http://tinney.net/

title: 5 Ways to Streamline the Pull Request Review Process - Calibre

last_post.content:
we put a lot of effort into ensuring anyone, no matter their role, can contribute to @calibre using pull requests.

here, @benschwarz explains a handful of strategies for how we use pull requests, including:

🔸 templates (we open sourced ours!)
🔸 automating web performance tests (test early!)
🔸 alerting for requested reviews
🔸 ...and a few more 😊
